category.name: Aptitude
category.description: Develop mathematical reasoning and problem-solving skills for competitive exams and interviews.

sub_categories.name: Arithmetic
sub_categories.description: Master arithmetic operations, number theory, and mathematical problem-solving techniques.

exercises.title: Number Theory
exercises.description: Solve problems involving prime numbers, factors, and number properties.

tasks.title: Prime Factorization
tasks.question:
Write a function to find the prime factorization of a number.

Your function should:

  • Accept a positive integer n
  • Find all prime factors of n
  • Return the factorization in exponential form
  • Handle edge cases (1, prime numbers)
  • Return factors in ascending order
tasks.hint: Use trial division, check divisibility by primes up to √n, count occurrences of each factor

tasks.title: Prime Number Properties
tasks.question:
What is the smallest prime number greater than 50?

Consider: Prime numbers are only divisible by 1 and themselves
tasks.hint: Check numbers after 50 for primality by testing divisibility

tasks.title: GCD and LCM Calculator
tasks.question:
Implement functions to calculate GCD and LCM of two numbers.

Your functions should:

  • Calculate GCD using Euclidean algorithm
  • Calculate LCM using GCD formula
  • Handle negative numbers and zero
  • Return results efficiently
  • Validate input parameters
tasks.hint: Use Euclidean algorithm for GCD: gcd(a,b) = gcd(b, a%b), then LCM = (a*b)/gcd(a,b)

exercises.title: Percentage and Profit Loss
exercises.description: Solve complex percentage problems and profit-loss calculations.

tasks.title: Compound Interest Calculator
tasks.question:
Create a compound interest calculator with different compounding frequencies.

Your calculator should:

  • Accept principal, rate, time, and compounding frequency
  • Calculate compound interest and total amount
  • Support annual, semi-annual, quarterly, monthly compounding
  • Show interest earned and final amount
  • Handle decimal precision correctly
tasks.hint: Use formula A = P(1 + r/n)^(nt) where n is compounding frequency per year

tasks.title: Successive Percentage Changes
tasks.question:
If a number increases by 20% and then decreases by 10%, what is the net percentage change?

Consider: Successive percentage changes are not additive
tasks.hint: Use formula: net change = (1 + p1/100)(1 + p2/100) - 1

tasks.title: Profit Loss Analysis
tasks.question:
Write a function to analyze profit/loss scenarios with multiple parameters.

Your function should:

  • Calculate profit/loss percentage given cost and selling price
  • Find selling price for desired profit percentage
  • Calculate cost price given selling price and profit percentage
  • Handle discount and markup scenarios
  • Return detailed analysis with all calculations
tasks.hint: Use formulas: Profit% = ((SP-CP)/CP)*100, SP = CP*(1+P/100), CP = SP/(1+P/100)
